paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Val142Ile, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Central Italy, mixed age and sex

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with cardiomyopathy and neuropathy at age 50.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with neuropathy at age 59.
Patient P4 has not developed any symptoms.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val142Ile variant leads to misfolding of the transthyretin protein, contributing to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.population_frequency: Higher prevalence in central Italy compared to other regions.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical and functional data.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the founder effect in the population.
key_quotes: The high recurrence of p.Val142Ile in central Italy is due to a founder effect.
This suggests a probable underestimate of the global prevalence of p.Val142Ile.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographics and clinical features of patients with TTR variants.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was clearly presented in the main text and tables.
